title.value: Assessing the impact of aircraft arrival on ambient ultrafine particle number concentrations in near-airport communities in Boston, Massachusetts
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the main focus of the study, which is assessing the impact of aircraft arrival on ambient ultrafine particle concentrations near airports in Boston.
title.quote: Assessing the impact of aircraft arrival on ambient ultrafine particle number concentrations in near-airport communities in Boston, Massachusetts

extractions.description: The study evaluates the contribution of arrival aircraft to ultrafine particle number concentrations (PNC) in six monitoring sites located at varying distances from Boston Logan International Airport. It investigates the correlation between aircraft activity and PNC, utilizing real-time data.

type.justification: The study involves real-world data collection and analysis to evaluate the impact of aircraft on particle concentrations, indicating empirical research.
type.quote: The objective of this study was to evaluate the impact of arrival aircraft on particle number concentration (PNC), a proxy for UFP, across six study sites 3â€“17 km from a major arrival aircraft flight path into Boston Logan International Airport by utilizing real-time aircraft activity and meteorological data.

name.justification: The study focuses on understanding the environmental health impact of ultrafine particles originating from aircraft in communities near airports.
name.quote: Department of Environmental Health, School of Public Health, Boston University, Boston, MA, USA

name.justification: The study examines air pollution in the form of ultrafine particles resulting from aircraft emissions.
name.quote: Aircraft emissions contribute to overall ambient air pollution, including ultrafine particle (UFP) concentrations.

name.justification: The study analyzes contributions of emissions from aircraft to ultrafine particle concentrations near airports.
name.quote: The objective of this study was to evaluate the impact of arrival aircraft on particle number concentration (PNC), a proxy for UFP.
